com.myscript.atk.scw

Interface SingleCharWidgetApi


  • public interface SingleCharWidgetApi
    This interface describes the public API of the single character widget.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description

      Called when a backspace gesture is detected.

      Called when handwriting configuration ends.

      Called when a long press gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnPenAbortListener
      Called when the user aborts writing.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnPenDownListener
      Called when the user starts writing.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnPenMoveListener
      Called when the user is writing.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnPenUpListener
      Called when the user ends writing.

      Called when a return gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnSingleTapGestureListener
      Called when a single tap gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener
      Called when the text changes.

      • INK_FADE_OUT_AUTO

        static final int INK_FADE_OUT_AUTO
        Automatic selection of fade-out effect (default mode).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INK_FADE_OUT_NONE

        static final int INK_FADE_OUT_NONE
        No fade-out effect on a stroke basis, all strokes are faded out on freeze event. This mode is recommended for cursive and isolated handwriting recognition.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INK_FADE_OUT_AFTER_DELAY

        static final int INK_FADE_OUT_AFTER_DELAY
        Fade-out each individual stroke after the configured fade-out delay. This mode is recommended for superimposed handwriting recognition of latin, cyrillic and Korean scripts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INK_FADE_OUT_ON_PEN_UP

        static final int INK_FADE_OUT_ON_PEN_UP
        Fade-out each individual stroke by a specified amount on pen up event. This mode is recommended for superimposed handwriting recognition of Chinese and Japanese scripts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • registerCertificate

        boolean registerCertificate(byte[] certificate)
        Register MyScript engine certificate and return true on success, false on failure.
        Parameters:
        certificate - The MyScript engine certificate.
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure.

      • setStrokeLayerType

        void setStrokeLayerType(int type)
        Set the type of layer backing for stroke views of the widget. The layer can be either:
        • LAYER_TYPE_NONE
        • LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE
        • LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
        The widget does not use any backing layer by default for stroke views. Hardware layer can be used to slightly improve smoothness of the rendering, at the expense of higher GPU memory consumption.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of layer to use for stroke views of the widget.

      • getStrokeLayerType

        int getStrokeLayerType()
        Return the type of layer backing for stroke views of the widget.
        Returns:
        The type of layer used for stroke views of the widget.

      • setInkFadeOutEffect

        void setInkFadeOutEffect(int effect)
        Set the ink fade-out effect.
        Parameters:
        effect - Fade-out effect type or -1 to revert to default value.
        • Automatic selection of fade-out effect (default mode) INK_FADE_OUT_AUTO
        • No fade-out effect on a stroke basis, all strokes are faded out on freeze event. This mode is recommended for cursive and isolated handwriting recognition INK_FADE_OUT_NONE
        • Fade-out each individual stroke after the configured fade-out delay. This mode is recommended for superimposed handwriting recognition of latin, cyrillic and Korean scripts INK_FADE_OUT_AFTER_DELAY
        • Fade-out each individual stroke by a specified amount on pen up event. This mode is recommended for superimposed handwriting recognition of Chinese and Japanese scripts INK_FADE_OUT_ON_PEN_UP
        See Also:
        setInkFadeOutDelay(int), setInkFadeOutDuration(int), setInkFadeOutTo(float), setInkFadeOutStep(float)

      • setAutoFreezeDelay

        void setAutoFreezeDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which auto-freeze is triggered. Until characters are frozen, text interpreted by the widget is subject to change as more strokes are written, providing more context for handwriting recognition. Freezing characters is the process of removing the strokes associated to these characters from the widget, effectively setting the interpretation of these characters which won't change any more.

        The widget takes care of the freezing process automatically. Auto-freeze happens in various circumstances: to the whole text right after commit in superimposed mode, and to the leading part of the text after some predefined number of words or characters have been written.

        Parameters:
        delay - Auto-freeze delay in milliseconds or -1 to revert to default value.
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener.onTextChanged(SingleCharWidgetApi w, String text, boolean intermediate)

      • getAutoFreezeDelay

        int getAutoFreezeDelay()
        Return the delay after which auto-freeze is triggered.
        Returns:
        Auto-freeze delay in milliseconds.

      • setLongPressDelay

        void setLongPressDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which long press event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        delay - Long press delay in milliseconds or -1 to revert to default value.

      • setSpeedQualityCompromise

        void setSpeedQualityCompromise(int value)
        Set speed/quality compromise rating. Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        value - Speed/quality compromise rating or -1 to use value set in the .conf configuration file.

        Higher value gives better accuracy but reduces recognition speed
        Lower value improves recognition speed but accuracy is lower

      • getSpeedQualityCompromise

        int getSpeedQualityCompromise()
        Return speed/quality compromise rating.
        Returns:
        Speed/quality compromise rating or -1 if using value set in the .conf configuration file. value is between 0 and 255.
        See Also:
        setSpeedQualityCompromise(int)

      • setUserLexicon

        void setUserLexicon(List<String> lexicon)
        Set user lexicon (array of words). Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        lexicon - Array of user-defined words.

      • getUserLexicon

        List<String> getUserLexicon()
        Return user lexicon (array of words).
        Returns:
        Array of user-defined words.

      • setAutoSpaceEnabled

        void setAutoSpaceEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable auto-space feature. Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect. Note that this feature is only available for Asian languages (Chinese, Japanese and Korean) in superimposed handwriting mode.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Enable auto-space if true, disable if false.

      • isAutoSpaceEnabled

        boolean isAutoSpaceEnabled()
        Return whether auto-space feature is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if auto-space is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setTransliterationEnabled

        void setTransliterationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable transliteration feature. Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Enable transliteration if true, disable if false.

      • isTransliterationEnabled

        boolean isTransliterationEnabled()
        Return whether transliteration feature is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if transliteration is enabled, false otherwise.

      • enableGesture

        void enableGesture(int gesture)
        Enable detection of the specified gesture. Several gestures may be enabled at once by combining several gesture flags using an OR operation.

        The mul-lk-gesture.res handwriting resource is required to be able to detect gestures and must be added to the configuration script of the .conf file used during configuration.

        Parameters:
        gesture - Gesture(s) to enable. Available gestures:
        • all gestures (ALL_GESTURES),
        • single tap (GESTURE_SINGLE_TAP),
        • long press (GESTURE_LONG_PRESS),
        • backspace (GESTURE_BACKSPACE),
        • return (GESTURE_RETURN),
        • space (GESTURE_SPACE).

      • disableGesture

        void disableGesture(int gesture)
        Disable detection of the specified gesture. Several gestures may be disabled at once by combining several gesture flags using an OR operation.
        Parameters:
        gesture - Gesture(s) to disable.
        See Also:
        enableGesture(int)

      • isGestureEnabled

        boolean isGestureEnabled(int gesture)
        Return whether specified gesture is enabled.
        Parameters:
        gesture - Gesture flag.
        Returns:
        true if gesture is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setRecognitionMode

        void setRecognitionMode(int mode)
        Set the handwriting recognition mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - Recognition mode.
        • Automatic selection of recognition mode from configured resources (default) RECOGNITION_MODE_AUTO
        • Superimposed recognition mode RECOGNITION_MODE_SUPERIMPOSED
        • Isolated recognition mode RECOGNITION_MODE_ISOLATED
        • Cursive recognition mode with multi-line support RECOGNITION_MODE_CURSIVE

      • getRecognitionMode

        int getRecognitionMode()
        Return the handwriting recognition mode.
        Returns:
        Recognition mode.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear ink and text contained in the widget.

      • setText

        void setText(String text)
        Set the text managed by this widget.
        Parameters:
        text - String representation of the text (may be null).
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener

      • getText

        String getText()
        Return the text managed by this widget.
        Returns:
        String representation of the text.

      • replaceCharacters

        boolean replaceCharacters(int start,
                          int end,
                          String text)
        Replace characters in the text. This method can be used to select an alternate handwriting recognition candidate for any word or character. The specified character range shall span a word or a single character, and the provided replacement text shall be one of the possible candidates to trigger a word or character candidate change.

        Characters may be inserted at any location in the text by calling this method with the same start and end character indices and a non-empty replacement string.

        Characters may be deleted from the text by calling this method with a non-empty characters range and an empty or null replacement string.

        Parameters:
        start - Character index of the first character to replace.
        end - Character index past the last character to replace.
        text - Replacement text string (may be null).
        Returns:
        true if the operation has been applied, false if the index range is invalid or the widget is busy processing.
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener, getWordCandidates(int), getCharacterCandidates(int)

      • getWordCandidates

        com.myscript.atk.text.CandidateInfo getWordCandidates(int index)
        Return alternate candidate info for the word at specified index. This method computes the character range of the word at specified index, and provides alternate candidates and possible completions and predictions.

        Alternate candidates can be selected by calling the replaceCharacters(int, int, String) method with parameters from the candidate information object.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the word.
        Returns:
        Candidate information for the word at specified index or null if index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        CandidateInfo, replaceCharacters(int, int, String)

      • getCharacterCandidates

        com.myscript.atk.text.CandidateInfo getCharacterCandidates(int index)
        Return alternate candidate info for the character at specified index. This method computes the character range of the character at specified index, and provides alternate candidates as well as prediction and completion options.

        Alternate candidates can be selected by calling the replaceCharacters(int, int, String) method with parameters from the candidate information object.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the character.
        Returns:
        Candidate information for the character at specified index or null if index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        CandidateInfo, replaceCharacters(int, int, String)

      • addStroke

        Add a stroke to the widget.
        Parameters:
        points - List of point information.

      • penDown

        Simulate a pen down event. This simulates a user that starts writing.
        Parameters:
        point - Point information.

      • penUp

        void penUp(com.myscript.atk.core.CaptureInfo point)
        Simulate a pen up event. This simulates a user that ends writing.
        Parameters:
        point - Point information.

      • penMove

        void penMove(com.myscript.atk.core.CaptureInfo point)
        Simulate a pen move event. This simulates a user writing.
        Parameters:
        point - Point information.

      • penAbort

        void penAbort()
        Simulate a pen abort event. This simulates a user canceling a stroke.

      • commit

        void commit(boolean clearInk)
        Commit the current writing session, optionally clear ink from the screen. This method commits the current writing session if not empty and starts a new one. If the current writing session is empty, the widget does not start a new one.

        The meaning of a writing session depends on the current handwriting recognition mode.

        • In superimposed mode, a writing session represents any kind of text (from a single character up to several sentences) with each character written on top of the other. A commit operation freezes all strokes and text interpretation, keeps them and starts a new writing session.
        • In isolated mode, a writing session represents a single character. A commit operation indicates the end of the current character and starts the next one.
        • In cursive mode, a writing session is a single screen page, which represents from a single character up to several words and sentences, laid out on a single or multiple lines. A commit operation indicates the end of the current screen page and starts the next one.

        Strokes currently displayed on the screen are either kept or removed from the screen based on the value of the clearInk parameter.

        This method may be ignored if the widget is not configured, as the recognition mode could not be automatically detected and this information is required. If you plan on using this API before widget is configured, please consider setting the recognition mode explicitly using the provided API method.

        Parameters:
        clearInk - Clear ink from the screen if true, keep ink if false.
        See Also:
        setAutoCommitEnabled(boolean), setAutoCommitDelay(int), setRecognitionMode(int)

      • setInsertIndex

        void setInsertIndex(int index)
        Set the index of the insertion point in the text.
        Parameters:
        index - Character index of the insertion point.

      • getInsertIndex

        int getInsertIndex()
        Return the index of the insertion point in the text.
        Returns:
        Character index of the insertion point.

      • insertString

        void insertString(String string)
        Insert the given string at the insertion point. This method inserts the given string into the input stream of the handwriting recognizer without freezing strokes. This method is particularly useful when implementing space or any other button.

        This method may be ignored if the widget is not configured, as the recognition mode could not be automatically detected and this information is required. If you plan on using this API before widget is configured, please consider setting the recognition mode explicitly using the provided API method.

        Parameters:
        string - String to insert at the insertion point in the text.
        See Also:
        setInsertIndex(int), setRecognitionMode(int)

      • clearSearchPath

        void clearSearchPath()
        Clear handwriting resources search path.

      • addSearchDir

        void addSearchDir(String directoryName)
        Add given directory to handwriting resources search path. Directory name can point to a folder in the file system, or to a directory in a zip file. Handwriting resources can be loaded directly from the assets folder of an apk file, as shown below. 
           widget.addSearchDir("zip://" + getContext().getPackageCodePath() + "!/assets/conf");
        Parameters:
        directoryName - Path to a folder containing handwriting resources.

      • configure

        void configure(String bundleName,
               String configName)
        Configure handwriting recognition engine. This method is non-blocking and returns immediately.

        Configuration is a lengthy process that may take up to several seconds, depending on the handwriting resources to be configured. It is recommended to setup a configuration listener to detect the end of the configuration process.

        When the device is rotated, Android completely recreates the UI without restarting the process of the application. After the device has been rotated, you need to configure the new instance of SingleCharWidgetApi by calling this method again.

        Open the .conf file to see examples of bundleName and configName.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Name of the configuration bundle (for example, "en-US").
        configName - Name of the configuration mode (for example, "text").
        See Also:
        clearSearchPath(), addSearchDir(String), SingleCharWidgetApi.OnConfiguredListener

      • getErrorCode

        int getErrorCode()
        Return an error code describing the last configuration error.
        Returns:
        Error code describing the error or 0 if no error.

      • getErrorString

        String getErrorString()
        Return a string describing the last configuration error.
        Returns:
        String describing the error.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Manually dispose all resources created by this widget. The widget must not be used after this method is called, any call to widget methods will raise a java.lang.IllegalStateException.

      • isDisposed

        boolean isDisposed()
        Return whether the widget has been disposed.
        Returns:
        true if the widget has been disposed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        dispose()
